result.execSummary:
All charges against Richard Thomas Weiting III in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Thomas Weiting III is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Thomas Weiting III

defendant.name: Weiting, Richard Thomas, III
defendant.address: 4816 First Street, Upper Apt., Laona, WI 54541

records.addlTxt: 01:31 PM Defendant Richard Thomas Weiting in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case, believes we are waiting for governor's warrant. State - makes statement, moves to dismiss 22CF11, according to KS there was a mistake, however there has been a referral for violation in WI, Weiting has now registered but just makes him aware there maybe charges coming. Court upon motion of state 22CF11 will be dismissed. Weiting - tries to make statement. Court stops him from making any further statements regarding registration.
Extradition hearing on March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:17 PM Defendant Richard Thomas Weiting in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. Weiting stated he is working with authorities to get the warrant taken care of out of Kansas, has registered in the State of Wisconsin. Court explains warrant is still active, needs to be addressed, court is still waiting for governor's warrant, if doesn't have by next hearing, may dismiss. Court needs proof Kansas warrant is taken care of. State - unsure of status in Kansas. Discussion regarding time limits. Court instructs Weiting to contact Kansas and get this taken care of. Weiting understands. Court has set for another extradition hearing for 3/30/22 at 1:30 PM.
Extradition hearing on March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:52 PM Defendant Richard Thomas Weiting in court, in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Set for extradition hearing. Court questions defendant, warrant from Kansas, defendant agrees he is the person listed in the complaint. Weiting does not want to be extradited, notes his mother tried to file paperwork with the court showing he lived in Forest County. Court explains extradition process, warrant was issued from the State of Kansas. Weiting indicates he informed them that he was moving last July and once he was in Forest County he went to the sheriff's office here to update them with his residence - was told he did not need to inform them. Court finds he is the individual listed in the warrant, finds he is a fugitive from Kansas. Court explains how extradition works, gives him rights under governors warrant. Weiting understands and indicates he was not a resident of Kansas at the time of the warrant. Court will hold for application of a governors warrant. Weiting indicates he has an attorney in Merrill. Court advises of right to an attorney, SPD, private hire or court appointed attorney if indigent. Court will set for and Extradition hearing on 3/7/22 at 1:30 PM.  State to prepare governors warrant. Weiting asks for bond. Court questions employment and residence. Weiting responds. State does not object to a $1000 cash bond. Court imposes cash bond of $1000.  Extradition hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard Thomas Weiting III

Prior: 820B 3rd Ave, Winfield, KS 67156 United States
Extradition hearing on February 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
